intro: Aucuba japonica var. mascula, commonly known as the male Japanese aucuba, is a variant of the evergreen shrub native to Japan. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are typically narrower and more elongated compared to the standard variety. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers, but it is notable for its male flowers, which are more prominent in this variant. It thrives in partial to full shade and is often used in ornamental landscaping for its hardy nature and attractive foliage. This variety is prized for its resilience and ability to maintain its appearance in shaded garden environments.
